#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Paint Circles
#Text=While some expert artists may be able to paint circles freehand , there 's no need to put yourself through the same challenge .
#Text=A few basic tools can make painting a circle much more manageable .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Drawing Pencil Guidelines
#Text=Choose your graphite .
#Text=A very light shade of graphite is ideal to prevent the marks from showing through your paint .
#Text=This is especially important if you paint with watercolours or other thin paint , which requires a 6H pencil or an even paler option .
#Text=It 's okay to have faint pencil lines showing through watercolour , as long as they are n't too obvious .
#Text=Some artists even use this intentionally , sketching in pencil then applying a very thin wash of paint over it .
#Text=Draw a circle with a compass .
#Text=Insert the pencil into a drawing compass .
#Text=Place the compass point against the paper and carefully rotate the compass to draw a precise circle .
#Text=Alternatively , place a circular object flat against the canvas and trace around it .
#Text=Paint with the pencil marks as guidelines .
#Text=Paint inside the pencil marks carefully , with a thin brush .
#Text=If the pencil lines are dark enough to stand out , you can instead wash over the whole sketch , letting the pencil communicate the shape .
#Text=Using Objects and Stencils
#Text=Find a circular object the right size for your project .
#Text=Items such as coffee cups , cereal bowls , and lids from coffee cans or oatmeal containers work well as circle patterns .
#Text=If you ca n't find anything the right size , cut out your own paper circles using a compass and scissors .
#Text=Dab the paint directly with the object .
#Text=If you 're using thick paint and want to go for a textured effect , dip the circular object directly in the paint and place it against the canvas .
#Text=Using a glass rim allows you to paint a thin circular line , instead of a solid circle .
#Text=Create a stencil instead .
#Text=Place the object on a blank sheet of heavy-duty paper and trace around it .
#Text=Cut this circle out carefully with a sharp pair of scissors , and you 'll be left with a stencil .
#Text=Alternatively , use a drawing compass to create a circle of any size .
#Text=Make a piece of tape less sticky .
#Text=This may sound strange , but a fresh piece of tape can damage your paper or canvas .
#Text=First , stick a couple pieces of tape to a pair of jeans , then peel them off .
#Text=Repeat several times until the tape is only barely sticky .
#Text=Other fabric works as well , but jeans are best .
#Text=Fasten the stencil to your artwork .
#Text=Place the paper stencil over your artwork , so the circular hole is exactly where you want to paint .
#Text=Fasten the stencil using the special pieces of tape .
#Text=Paint inside the circle .
#Text=Apply the paint with a large brush , using thin , even strokes and avoiding drips or spills .
#Text=You may want to use a thinner brush for the outer rim of the circle .
#Text=Before you move on , step back a few steps to get a better view .
#Text=Touch up the circle if you want more even coverage or a different brush stroke pattern .
#Text=Carefully remove the stencil .
#Text=Slowly lift the tape to reduce the chance of tearing the tape or picking up paint .
#Text=You can reuse this stencil , but you may need to prepare more " special tape . "
#Text=Tips
#Text=For a 3D effect , lay the paint very thickly over the circle ( this is the " impasto " method ) .
#Text=If you really want it to bulge out , you can go mixed medium and glue a scrunched up circle of tissue paper to the painting and paint over it .
#Text=To draw dots , dip the end of a pencil in paint and dab it against the canvas .
#Text=Not every painting tries to be as neat as possible .
#Text=Some painters , particularly abstract ones , sometimes make their shapes intentionally messy with drips and splashes .
#Text=Things
#Text=You 'll Need
#Text=Paint ( any kind )
#Text=Paintbrush
#Text=Using Pencils
#Text=Very soft pencil
#Text=Drawing
#Text=compass
#Text=Using Stencils
#Text=Circular object
#Text=Heavy-duty paper
#Text=Pen/pencil
#Text=Scissors
#Text=Tape
